summary: The "Lowering Obstacles to Achievement Now Act" (LOAN Act) aims to amend the Higher Education Act of 1965. Key provisions include doubling Pell Grant awards, improving the Public Service Loan Forgiveness program, reducing student loan interest rates, and creating new repayment plans with options for income-driven repayment and fixed repayment. The bill also addresses loan refinancing for both federal and private student loans, and tackles issues related to borrower eligibility, default, and interest capitalization.
